GameEventAction.Description: We are receiving troubling reports from various of our ships and those of other empires. The typical movement patterns of the Gravillex and Ardilus creatures appear to have... changed. These creatures typically migrate in ways peculiar to their own interests. Such patterns have always appeared to us as random. Now these space creatures behave as though drawn to systems with colonies or other assets vital to our empire. We do not know what has prompted these changes or if this behavior will continue. For now, all we can do is observe and take precautions.

GameEvent.Name: Creature Migration Patterns Caused by Shakturi

GameEventAction.MessageTitle: Creature Migration Patterns Caused by Shakturi
GameEventAction.Description:
Our research into Genetic Engineering has given us new insights in understanding how the Shakturi created and control Rift Striders. With the emergence of the Shakturi from the rifts we have also been able to shed some light on a mystery that has, until now, confounded our scientists. Some time ago we observed a shift in the migration patterns of Gravillex and Ardilus, in which they appeared to be drawn to systems with colonies and other valuable assets.
We are now certain that this is not a natural occurrence. It seems that the Shakturi are capable not only of controlling their own creations, but also influencing creatures native to our galaxy. They are driving the Gravillex and Ardilus toward our systems, effectively weaponizing them against us. We must continue with our research in this area if we are to discover the means of countering Shakturi influence over these space creatures.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Shakturi Infiltration in Friendly Empire Spy Success Chance
Shakturi Non-Boskara Player Spy Success Chance
Shakturi Non-Boskara Player Ambassador Success Chance
A Shakturi Infiltrator Spy Success Chance

GameEventAction.Description: We have completed our preliminary research into the expanding gravitic rift. We have not yet discovered the source of the expansion nor determined the full danger they represent, but we have learned that the mysterious energy has psychic properties. This is a worrying discovery. Continuing to investigate the rifts will consume much of our scientific resources, but we may have an opportunity to learn how to suppress the energy and stabilize these rifts.

Gravitic rifts in several systems have begun to destabilize, distorting nearby space and producing effects that mystify our scientists. Some of the readings from these rifts suggest the presence of a powerful and unknown energy type.
It is too early to determine how these destabilizations will affect neighboring systems or how far the damage will spread, but there is reason for alarm. A new energy source spreading throughout the galaxy could have serious, perhaps dire, consequences.
Our scientists have flagged the closest of these destabilizations, at {0} in the {1} system. It would be prudent to investigate this phenomenon further.

Gravitic rifts in several systems have begun to destabilize, distorting nearby space and producing effects that mystify our scientists. Some of the readings from these rifts suggest the presence of powerful psychic energy.
It is too early to determine how these destabilizations will affect neighboring systems or how far the damage will spread, but there is reason for alarm. A new psychic energy source spreading throughout the galaxy could have serious, perhaps dire, consequences.
Our scientists have flagged the closest of these destabilizations, at {0} in the {1} system. It would be prudent to investigate this phenomenon further.

The space around this gravitic rift is a maelstrom of powerful and mysterious energy readings. The rift appears to be growing, which is troubling enough, but also shifting, as though transforming into something entirely new. This is a phenomenon unlike anything we have previously encountered.
Understanding the nature of these rifts and their unusual energy would consume a significant portion of our scientific resources, but can we afford to ignore this phenomenon? While much of the history of our galaxy has been lost, we have recovered enough information about the past to know that responding to early signs of danger may be vital to our survival.

The rift appears to be growing, which is troubling enough, but also shifting, as though transforming into something entirely new. This is a phenomenon unlike anything we have previously encountered.
Understanding the nature of these rifts and their unusual energy would consume a significant portion of our scientific resources, but can we afford to ignore this phenomenon? [RESEARCH]We should continue our research into psychic energy[/RESEARCH] if we are to prepare for whatever comes next.

We've made great progress in understanding how the gravitic rifts work and the nature of their psychic energy. Our scientists are confident they can use that information to help devise countermeasures to that energy. We also believe we can slow the destabilization of these rifts, but this is only a temporary solution. Our efforts cannot prevent the rifts from expanding, but we have likely bought ourselves some time. Now we must use that time wisely.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Second Rift Research Completed Delayed Result

GameEvent.Name: Second Rift Research Completed Delayed Result

GameEventAction.Description: We have been able to slow the destabilization of the gravitic rifts that have appeared throughout our galaxy, but we haven’t been able to stop them entirely. This is a victory, but our scientists suspect that this is but the beginning of a crisis, not the end. We must now begin the impossible task of preparing for the unknown.

Mysterious creatures, unlike anything we've ever encountered, have emerged from the expanding gravitic rifts. In a galaxy filled with varied and surprising life forms, these things are truly... alien.
They are not only dangerous, destroying everything in their path, but they also appear to act with an intention that suggests a purpose.
We don't know what these creatures are, or what their goals might be, but they must be stopped.

We've managed to destroy one of the alien rift creatures. A cursory examination of its corpse revealed, among other things, an orderly anatomical structure that suggests something artificial, yet the creature is undeniably alive.
Moreover, these creatures contain crystals that cannot be biological, at least as we understand the term, and show every sign of growing within, and being interconnected with, the creatures' bodies. The crystals' energy signature is nearly identical to that of the mysterious rifts that have been appearing in our galaxy.
If we are going to protect ourselves, we must understand more about the creatures' nature and abilities. It is vital that our scientists commit to researching these remains as quickly as possible.
If we can collect enough of the rift creature crystals, we should be able to progress our research and learn more about them.

We have completed our initial analysis of the rift creatures’ remains. Its anatomy is segmented and, in some ways, recognizably insectoid, but our initial impression of a mechanical or constructed anatomy is hard to dismiss. Our scientists tell us that the creatures are undeniably alive and yet also undeniably constructed. They are, in other words, most likely the product of some sort of advanced genetic engineering.
Perhaps more importantly, we've learned a great deal about the crystals we found within the creatures' bodies. They are connected and fed by the responding tissue, and yet they are indisputably inorganic. Moreover, their energy signature is not merely similar to that of the galactic rifts, it is somehow interacting with those rifts.
What is the nature of that interaction? Some scientists believe that the rifts somehow sustain the creatures, whereas others suspect a form of communication or perhaps mind control. What is undeniable is that a better understanding of the creatures is vital to understanding the rifts themselves.
We must prioritize further research into the creatures and their crystals.

We have completed our further study of the rift creatures and their strange crystals. There is no longer any doubt that the creatures are the product of a sophisticated genetic engineering project vastly beyond our understanding. And yet, if were to improve our understanding, we would be well positioned not only to fight these creatures, but also to apply this knowledge to our own projects. If we could enhance our own genetics, there is almost no limit to what we could achieve.
We have also learned more about the rift crystals found in the creatures' bodies. They are, as we suspected, interacting with the rifts. The crystals appear to be what allowed the creatures to move through the rifts. Additionally, the creatures are in constant communication with the rifts. We cannot know with any certainty the specific nature of that communication, but all signs point to a psychic record of everything the creatures do and see. The rift creatures are, in other words, spies, reporting our activities back to their masters. We must now accept that we are under a powerful enemy's watchful eye.

We have completed further investigations into the biology of the mysterious Rift Strider creature.
Our findings indicate that the brain plasma of these creatures has potent plague curing properties.
Perhaps harvesting this resource will help us manage the rapidly spreading Psionic virus and other diseases.

GameEvent.Name: Creatures Encountered by Non-Player Faction First

GameEventAction.Description: We have received a message from [OTHER FACTION], who report that mysterious creatures, unlike anything we’ve ever encountered, have emerged from the expanding gravitic rifts. In a galaxy filled with varied and surprising life forms, these things are truly… alien. They are not only dangerous, destroying everything in their path, but they also appear to act with an intention that suggests a larger purpose. We don’t know what these creatures are, or what their goals might be, but they must be stopped.

It cannot be a coincidence. After the appearance of the Rift Strider creature in the {1} System, the inhabitants of {0} were struck with a strange plague.
The plague appears to affect the victims' brains in ways our doctors cannot understand. Some suffer massive neurological failure and die, but most survive and are... altered.
The victims appear to lose inhibition and judgement. They behave almost as if intoxicated, disregarding danger and propriety. Worse, many appear to pursue a common purpose. There have been acts of sabotage and military defections. The plague appears to be designed to weaken its victims.
The plague is spreading rapidly, and conventional therapies have proved to be completely ineffective. Finding a cure must be our highest priority, but there may be more at stake. If we can understand the nature of the disease and how it was delivered, perhaps we can guard against future assaults.
Our scientists say they would like as many samples of Rift Strider remains as possible for their studies.

The Rift Striders are fascinating and mysterious creatures. There is much to be learned by studying them, but our team has been focused specifically on the link between the creatures and the plagues they appear to spread. Indeed, within the creatures' brain plasma they have found the virus that is now afflicting worlds in our galaxy.
The virus does not appear to harm the creatures. Rather, they seem designed to spread it to the populations they encounter. That means we must reevaluate our understanding of what these creatures are and the threat they pose. They are not merely navigational hazards for our ships. They are weapons, and they threaten sentient life wherever they encounter it.
We must now work to understand the mechanism through which they spread their plague. Since there is no physical contact between the creatures and their victims, we believe the plague is psychic in nature. While the nature and mechanics of the psionic plague is utterly alien, we are confident that with the investment of more resources, we will be able to find a cure.

Further study of the Rift Striders' brains has produced significant results. Our scientists were able to determine that the virus was biologically engineered to attack the functioning of virtually any sentient species’ brains. It is extremely sophisticated psychic and genetic technology, far beyond our understanding. Fortunately, we do not need to understand all of its intricacies to free ourselves of this plague. We now know enough to consider how a cure might be created.
We cannot stop there, however. An enemy that can produce one plague can likely produce another. We must not assume the threat is over. We would be wise to explore further when we can so that we can better defend ourselves against an enemy with a sophisticated and deadly understanding of psychic technology.
It is also possible that this technology could in the future be turned against the sinister minds that developed it. Understanding psychic and biological weaponry could well be vital to our war efforts. There is much more work to be done if we are to survive... and triumph.

It cannot be a coincidence. {20} reports that after the appearance of the Rift Strider creature in the {1} system, the inhabitants of {0} were struck with a strange plague.
The plague appears to affect the victims' brains in ways our doctors cannot understand. Some suffer massive neurological failure and die, but most survive and are... altered.
The victims appear to lose inhibition and judgement. They behave almost as if intoxicated, disregarding danger and propriety. Worse, many appear to pursue a common purpose. There have been acts of sabotage and military defections. The plague appears to be designed to weaken its victims.
We cannot assume this plague will not come for our own worlds. Finding a cure must be our highest priority, but there may be more at stake. If we can understand the nature of the disease and how it was delivered, perhaps we can guard against future assaults.
Our scientists say they would like as many samples of Rift Strider remains as possible for their studies.

We are receiving alarming reports from the vicinity of the gravitic rifts. [B]Ships are emerging[/B]. They are of a strange design, like nothing we've seen before, and yet there is something about their appearance that resonates with our people. It is eerie and inexplicably familiar.
Anything approaching the ships has been destroyed, and we have received garbled reports of strange energies affecting anyone attacked. These ships appear to be drawn toward a particular destination, perhaps at the galactic rim. Their goals remain mysterious, and we have had no direct confirmation of their identity, and yet we cannot help but fear the worst.
Had we dedicated more resources to understanding these rifts, this crisis could have been delayed, though it is now clear this day would come eventually.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Creature Migration Patterns Caused by Shakturi

GameEventAction.Description:
We have encountered the aliens from the rift. They are strange, unfathomable, unnerving... and familiar. We have previously encountered remnants of the Shakturi, and as much as we might wish that these aliens merely resemble that ancient menace, we cannot deny the truth. These are Shakturi. They have returned.
Everything we have achieved since returning to the stars is now in peril. Our existence itself is in peril.
Nevertheless, we are not helpless. The arrival of the Shakturi, and the unique events that have preceded that arrival, have now fully opened new avenues of research and discovery. There are now additional new projects for our scientists to undertake.
The Shakturi incursion has opened the possibility of further study into Paranormal, Genetic, and Bioengineering warfare techniques, which the enemy used against our ancestors in the ancient war and clearly still employs. In the war to come, we must learn to use this knowledge ourselves to survive this new enemy. Only by conducting this advanced research can we hope to eventually defeat the Shakturi.

We have encountered the aliens from the rift, and they are unlike anything we've ever seen or even imagined. They are strange, unfathomable, unnerving....
Our crews report feeling uneasy simply from being in proximity to these ships. They experience thoughts, see images, experience emotions that are not their own. They are alien. They see flashes of the past, of ancient space battles and planetary destruction.
And in spite of how alien and unfamiliar the aliens seem, there is something recognizable about them. It is as though they are dislodging dim memories locked away in our genetic code.

Our greatest fears have been realized. The great enemy that once nearly destroyed all life in the galaxy, has returned. We once more face the Shakturi. Everything we have achieved since returning to the stars is now in peril. Our existence itself is in peril.
Nevertheless, we are not helpless. The arrival of the Shakturi, and the unique events that have preceded that arrival, have now fully opened new avenues of research and discovery. There are now additional new projects for our scientists to undertake.
The Shakturi incursion has opened the possibility of further study into Paranormal, Genetic, and Bioengineering warfare techniques, which the enemy used against our ancestors in the ancient war and clearly still employs. In the war to come, we must learn to use this knowledge ourselves to survive this new enemy. Only by conducting this advanced research can we hope to eventually defeat the Shakturi.

We are receiving reports that the Shakturi fleet has reached its destination at the galactic rim. Long range sensors indicate that there is a mysterious beacon, previously undetectable, that may have drawn them to their location. The ships appear to be engaged in some sort of massive construction project. We cannot know what they are building, but it does not bode well for peace in our galaxy.
We’re receiving reports that a ship from the Shakturi fleet has been abandoned. It must have suffered a malfunction. Investigating this ship might yield vital information.

Our teams have reached the abandoned Shakturi ship. We can detect no sign of external damage, and we cannot guess why the ship was abandoned. It seems to radiate with some kind of psychic energy, which has many of our scientists feeling uneasy.
There are those on our team who believe that examining the ship presents too great a risk. Perhaps we would be better off destroying the ship and harvesting the wreckage as best we can.

We cannot take any chances with the Shakturi. It would have been foolish to step aboard this ship until we understand them and their technology better. Destroying it was almost certainly the right call.
In the wreckage we found some preserved samples from the space creatures -- their secondary brains. We have also retrieved some damaged but not destroyed devices which we can hope to reverse engineer. Perhaps this will give us a greater understanding of Shakturi technology.

The interior of the Shakturi ship has sustained significant damage. Our engineers speculate that the Shakturi attempted to destroy this ship, but something must have gone wrong with their self-destruct mechanism. Much of the equipment here is damaged beyond repair, but we have found a few mysterious devices that may help us gain a better understanding of our enemy.

Everything on this ship radiates psychic energy. Our scientists feel uneasy and anxious simply being on board, but we must keep pressing on.
We have analysed the hull of the ship, and it appears to be unfathomably old. It may date back more than a thousand years.
There are other unusual energy signatures. The ship is made from entirely alien components whose molecular structure we have never seen before. We suspect that it may not be from our galaxy at all.

It is difficult not to worry that we may have also opened door that would be better left closed. Some of our scientists reported feeling as though the devices somehow “saw” them, and then they experienced visions of the Shakturi gazing upon our homeworld.
The Shakturi now know who we are and where we come from. They know we are the ones who have taken hold of their abandoned ship. We can only wonder what price we will pay.
You explored our abandoned ship

Great surprise! Opportunity and danger! We have received a visitor from the Shakturi, offering an alliance of sorts. They wish to join with the Boskara, to become our partners, they say. The beginning of a mighty alliance, they say. Many fine offers. They promise immense wealth, incredible knowledge, unimagined power! Boskara can be the greatest of all the galactic races. The offer is very tempting. And yet we wonder. Can we say no?

Boskara cannot ignore the past. Boskara cannot forget the past. We have learned and discovered the truth about the last Shakturi invasion. They came and offered partnership with Boskara, and yet made us their minions. We were partners until we wished to act in ways the Shakturi did not wish. Then we discovered we were not partners. We were little better than slaves. Well treated slaves if we served well, but even so.
Still, better to be a living slave than dead Boskara. It is unlikely Shakturi wish to hear us decline their offer. This is a difficult decision. We have one year to decide.

Shakturi make many promises, but they are powerful. How do we know they will keep their promises. There is much to consider.
They give us one year to decide.

The Shakturi emissary has returned, demanding to hear our answer. Do we accept their offer for a "partnership," or do we defy these most powerful beings who have the galaxy cowering before them? What happens to Boskara if we accept? If we reject?

We accept the offer we cannot refuse.

There is no choice.

We will submit and profit.
We have resisted the Shakturi. They are full of anger. There will be violence.

We have received word that the Shakturi are attempting to entice the Boskara into joining their cause. An alliance with the Boskara could significantly increase the Shakturi’s power. Our survival may well depend on preventing such an alliance.
We must send a spy to learn more, and we should do so quickly. It would be wise to act immediately.
Should we send our best spy to investigate this grave threat?

GameEventCondition.VariableName: Shakturi Non-Boskara Player Spy Success Chance
Shakturi Non-Boskara Player Spy Success Chance

GameEventAction.Description: Our spy was too late! Though our agent began establishing contacts and undermining relationships, it appears it was not enough. The Shakturi and the Boskara have formed an alliance. The galaxy now faces a new Shaktur Axis. None of us are safe.

Our spy has safely returned with troubling information. It seems that the Boskara are, indeed, engaging in negotiations with the Shakturi. We must do what we can to sway the Boskara.
We should send an ambassador to persuade the Boskara. We should do this immediately if we hope to have any success.
Should we send our best Ambassador?

GameEventCondition.VariableName: Shakturi Non-Boskara Player Ambassador Success Chance
Shakturi Non-Boskara Player Ambassador Success Chance

GameEventAction.Description: Our ambassador has failed! At first the Boskara seemed receptive to our ideas, but the Shakturi counterpart was more persuasive, or perhaps offered incentives and threats we could not match. Regardless, the Shakturi and the Boskara have formed an alliance. The galaxy now faces a new Shaktur Axis. None of us are safe.

Unfortunately, our spy has been discovered before being able to verify any negotiations between the Shakturi and the Boskarans. As a result, we have done little more than anger the Boskarans.
We can hope that they make the right choice, though we fear we may have pushed them in the wrong direction.
We see how others attempt to sabotage our relations, yet we loyally resist them
We appreciate your loyalty
We have missed our chance to intervene with the formation of a Boskara/Shakturi alliance. Let's hope we don't regret our inaction.
We are impressed by your irresistable advance
We appreciate your loyalty

Wonderful news! Our ambassador has helped the Boskarans to see reason. They are willing to consider rejecting the overtures from the Shakturi, but they say it will cost us. Quite a lot.
There are no guarantees that any peace we make with the Boskara will last, so we need to consider our next move carefully.

The Boskara are... not reasonable. Our ambassador reported terrible conditions and cruel threats. Now we receive only silence. The Boskaran government denies that our ambassador ever arrived.
We can only assume the ambassador died a violent death. We fear what will come next.
We see how others attempt to undermine your greatness, yet we loyally resist them
We appreciate your loyalty

The Boskarans were happy to receive our credits, and our intelligence operatives report that they have refused all contact from the Shakturi.
In the context of a larger war, this is a small victory, but it could make all the difference.
We have been warned of your treachery and will not submit to your brutality
We do not believe any money we give to the Boskara will prevent them from betraying us. Our credits are better spent in supporting the war effort.
You Refused to Pay Our Bribe
We see how others attempt to undermine your greatness, yet we loyally resist them

One of our ships has broken formation. We are attempting to communicate, but we are having a hard time getting through.
We have managed to raise our ship that's broken formation, but the situation on board remains unclear. The officer we spoke with sounded confused and incoherent. In the background we heard screaming and sidearms discharging. Members of the crew could be heard shouting in a strange and alien tongue.
Then the officer we spoke with suddenly went silent. We heard a strange voice we did not recognize telling us we would soon die.
Some of the crew has now joined our enemy. A battle has broken out between these renegades and the rest of the crew.
We know the Shakturi possess psychic powers, but we have not always understood their scope and potential. If they can cause our own crews to turn against us, what else can they do?
We must learn more about their abilities if we are to combat this dangerous enemy.

We are receiving unusual readings from the galactic rim. There is a sudden burst of energy of a sort we do not recognize and on a scale never previously recorded. Something is going on there. It would be wise to investigate, though we should do so cautiously.

A closer examination of the energy source on the galactic rim reveals the existence of a mysterious "beacon." It appears to be releasing a massive surge of psychic energy. We do not understand the purpose or implications of the energy surge. This development requires close monitoring and further study.

Further analysis of the beacon reveals that this is not a simple burst of energy, but a tightly directed beam. It appears to be focused for some unknown purpose. What is the beam's target? What effect does the psychic energy have on that target? We must learn more.

It now appears that the beacon's psychic energy is directed at a specific location outside of our galaxy. Is this some form of communication? Perhaps it is some kind of navigational beacon. We simply don't know.
Though the nature and purpose of the beacon's energy surge remains a mystery, though studying it, our scientists believe they have improved their understanding of the fundamentals of psychic energy.

We are detecting an unprecedented amount of psychic energy emanating from the galactic rim. Something is happening there. Our scientists are confused. They have never seen anything like this before. Old hypotheses are being discarded. New ones are being formed and yet... only mystery remains.
It appears that this energy is attempting to tear the very fabric of space itself. We believe something terrible is coming.

Shortly after we discovered these psychic "beacons" on the galactic rim, we noticed three similar, if significantly less powerful, energy signatures. We don't think they are necessarily related to the beacons, but whatever is at these locations was likely built by the same intelligence that built the beacon. It may well be worth investigating.

A closer examination of the energy source on the galactic rim reveals the existence of a mysterious "beacon." It appears to be releasing a massive surge of an unknown energy. We do not understand the purpose or implications of the energy surge. This development requires close monitoring and further study.

We continue to monitor data from the beacon. We have concluded that this is not a simple burst of energy, but a tightly directed beam. It appears to be focused for some unknown purpose. What is the beam's target? What effect does the energy have on that target? We must learn more.

Our scientists now believe the beacon's energy is psychic in nature. We know very little about this ancient and powerful form of energy, and we cannot analyze or defend ourselves against a power we do not understand. The survival of our civilization may depend on investing in a research project to help us comprehend what we are facing.

Something incredible is happening. The beacons at the galactic rim have become... very active. They are tearing massive holes into the very fabric of space. This is a reordering of the laws of physics unlike anything we've ever seen. We don't know how this is possible.
Whoever and whatever can do this must surely be capable of things beyond our imagination. How do we prepare for the unimaginable?

We are receiving a signal from the galactic rim, at the location of a mysterious beacon. Information is fragmentary and unreliable, but there are reports of a fleet emerging from the rips in the fabric of space itself. This fleet includes a massive ship built on a scale unknown in our galaxy. These ships are reportedly firing on any ship they come across. No one has survived the encounter.
These rips in space are clearly a means of transportation, though its nature is beyond our experience and understanding. What will happen if we go to war with aliens who can travel by destroying space? Will our hyperdrive technology appear primitive and woefully inadequate by comparison?
We must prepare ourselves. If we can.

The Shakturi are expanding their influence. They have formed an alliance with another empire. It may be that this fight is too big for us to prevail on our own.
We should respond in kind by reaching out to allies, or potential allies, who share our values. Perhaps we can form an alliance and together we can do what would be impossible on our own.

We have established a strong relationship with {20}. It may be time to initiate talks of an alliance.
Do we want to send one of our ambassadors to attempt to begin negotiations that, we hope, could culminate in forming an alliance?

We have had several productive meetings with representatives of the {20}. They are clearly interested in an alliance, but they are worried about diluting their ability to defend their own territories.
{20} also has reasonable concerns about what such an alliance might look like and how their own internal goals and ambitions might be thwarted by needing to function within a larger multi-empire organization. Our ambassador is attempting to assuage their concerns while hammering out details about what the final form of such an alliance might take.
Let's give this process some time and see what results...

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Anti Shakturi Alliance No Defensive Tech

GameEventAction.Description:
Our negotiations with {20} have been disrupted by an assassination attempt! Our ambassador was nearly killed by members of the {20} delegation.
There were three assassins in all, and our ambassador was lucky to escape alive. The assassins were soon captured, and members of our delegation recognized clear signs of Shakturi psychic control. Thanks to our scientific advances in this field, we were able to interfere with the Shakturi control and release these poor victims from psychic enslavement.
Though the event began with chaos, our counterparts among the {20} were impressed with our handling of the situation and our ability to free their people. These events have completely changed the tone of our negotiations. {20} now sees the advantages of working with us and are ready to agree to an alliance as well as a scientific exchange.

GameEvent.Name: Anti Shakturi Alliance No Defensive Tech

GameEventAction.Description:
Disaster! Our negotiations with {20} have been disrupted by an assassination attempt! Our ambassador was nearly killed by members of the {20} delegation.
There were three assassins in all, and our ambassador was lucky to escape alive. Two of the assassins killed themselves as soon as they realized they had failed. The third was apprehended, but soon thereafter collapsed, falling into a coma and dying a few hours later.
All three assassins had long and distinguished careers as diplomats. We believe the Shakturi used their psychic abilities to control these individuals in an attempt to disrupt our negotiations. We can only hope this demonstration of the danger presented by the Shakturi will strengthen the resolve of our diplomats to forge a united alliance.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Anti Shakturi Alliance No Defensive Tech 2

GameEvent.Name: Anti Shakturi Alliance No Defensive Tech 2

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Anti Shakturi Alliance No Defensive Tech 3

GameEvent.Name: Anti Shakturi Alliance No Defensive Tech 3

GameEventAction.Description:
There has been another assassination attempt, this time the target was none other than the leader of the {20}. Our ambassador selflessly moved in front of {20}'s leader, using their own body to shield our potential ally's leader. Unfortunately, our ambassador is dead.
This act of heroism has convinced {20} to join with us. Are we ready to move ahead with forming this alliance?
GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Anti Shakturi Alliance No Defensive Tech Accept Offer

GameEvent.Name: Anti Shakturi Alliance No Defensive Tech Accept Offer

GameEventAction.Description:
We have sacrificed much and suffered hardships, but these experiences have only demonstrated the need of working together. An alliance offers us the best hope of defeating the Shakturi.
Historians may someday see this as the turning point in this conflict.
Upon further reflection, we believe there are times when alliances are advantageous, but this is not one of them. We will deal with the Shakturi ourselves.

We have received a disturbing report from one of our informants. Our friends, the {20}, may have a Shakturi agent operating at the highest levels in their government.
This is a sensitive time for the {20}. The struggle with the Shakturi has severely strained their resources, and they are having difficulty managing their own internal affairs. It would be a mistake to raise this issue until we know more.
The logical course of action is to investigate this matter ourselves. If we can uncover definitive proof, we can bring it to the {20} ourselves.
Should we send our best spy to investigate this situation?
GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Shakturi Infiltration in Friendly Empire Send Spy
Shakturi Infiltration in Friendly Empire Don't Investigate Choice

GameEvent.Name: Shakturi Infiltration in Friendly Empire Send Spy

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Shakturi Infiltration in Friendly Empire Spy Succeeds

GameEventCondition.VariableName: Shakturi Infiltration in Friendly Empire Spy Success Chance

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Shakturi Infiltration in Friendly Empire Spy Fails

GameEventCondition.VariableName: Shakturi Infiltration in Friendly Empire Spy Success Chance

GameEvent.Name: Shakturi Infiltration in Friendly Empire Spy Succeeds

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Shakturi Infiltration in Friendly Empire Spy Succeeds Defensive Tech Researched
Shakturi Infiltration in Friendly Empire Spy Succeeds Defensive Tech Not Researched

GameEvent.Name: Shakturi Infiltration in Friendly Empire Spy Succeeds Defensive Tech Researched

GameEventAction.Description:
Our agent was successful! After monitoring a group of suspicious individuals, our spy identified several Shakturi agents operating within {20}'s government. Thanks to our ability to recognize the signs of Shakturi mind control, we were able to isolate these unwitting agents and free them from the control of their Shakturi masters.
{20} is extremely grateful for our intervention. The Shakturi, on the other hand, are likely displeased with us. We have done our allies a great service, but we may have drawn our enemy's notice.
We appreciate your help to expose Shakturi infiltration
We are angered by your meddling in our subversion operations

GameEvent.Name: Shakturi Infiltration in Friendly Empire Spy Succeeds Defensive Tech Not Researched

GameEventAction.Description:
Our agent was successful! After monitoring a group of suspicious individuals, our spy identified several Shakturi agents operating within {20}'s government. When they learned that they had been exposed, each of the agents fell immediately unconscious and entered a coma. Death followed within hours.
{20} is extremely grateful for our intervention. The Shakturi, on the other hand, are likely displeased with us. We have done our allies a great service, but we may have drawn our enemy's notice.
We appreciate your help to expose Shakturi infiltration
We are angered by your meddling in our subversion operations

GameEvent.Name: Shakturi Infiltration in Friendly Empire Spy Fails

GameEventAction.Description: Our spy has been exposed, creating an unpleasant diplomatic incident. There have been angry communications, threats of retaliation, demonstrations against us on our ally's worlds. We sought only to help our allies uncover a danger in their midst, but we may have damaged our relations with them, ultimately hurting our war effort.
We are angered by your meddling in our internal affairs

GameEvent.Name: Shakturi Infiltration in Friendly Empire Don't Investigate Choice

GameEventAction.Description: It is probably wise not to involve ourselves with another government's internal issues.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Shakturi Infiltration in Friendly Empire Don't Investigate Choice 2

GameEvent.Name: Shakturi Infiltration in Friendly Empire Don't Investigate Choice 2

GameEventAction.Description: Our relationship with the {20} appears to be deteriorating. They show a lack of interest in coordinating with us to push back against the Shakturi. Even normal diplomatic interactions now feel strained.
We tire of your incessant warnings against the Shakturi

Something is happening on {0}. Our citizens have become angry and restless, expressing dissatisfaction with our administration.
A certain amount of civil disquiet has to be expected during a major galactic crisis, but there is something troubling about the anger we are seeing directed toward our government and our military. There have been public demonstrations condemning our leadership, absurd demands for an end to hostilities (as though we have any choice but to fight), and even those who imagine that the Shakturi are somehow the victims and we are the aggressors.

We have to consider the possibility that there are provocateurs among our population, deliberately creating this unrest. If the Shakturi have agents among our people, we must expose them, though we must acknowledge, given the current mood, that an investigation of this sort would require apprehending suspects, breaking up public demonstrations, and silencing certain voices. This could make the situation more volatile in the short term. It might be better to invest in a marketing campaign and use monetary incentives to persuade certain key figures to alter their message.
Should we send our best spy to investigate? Or simply spend money to influence the colony?

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: A Shakturi Infiltrator Throw Money at the Problem Choice
A Shakturi Infiltrator Investigate Unrest Choice Spy Succeeds

GameEventCondition.VariableName: A Shakturi Infiltrator Spy Success Chance

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: A Shakturi Infiltrator Investigate Unrest Choice Spy Fails

GameEventCondition.VariableName: A Shakturi Infiltrator Spy Success Chance

GameEvent.Name: A Shakturi Infiltrator Investigate Unrest Choice Spy Succeeds

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: A Shakturi Infiltrator Investigate Unrest Choice Spy Succeeds Defensive Tech Researched
A Shakturi Infiltrator Investigate Unrest Choice Spy Succeeds Defensive Tech Not Researched

GameEvent.Name: A Shakturi Infiltrator Investigate Unrest Choice Spy Succeeds Defensive Tech Researched

GameEventAction.Description:
Something strange is happening on {0}. Individuals our spy has interviewed have gone missing. Others have suddenly collapsed and fallen into comas.
Several suspects have either eluded capture or escaped from secure facilities, sometimes with the help of prison guards.
All of these events suggest the Shakturi are using their psychic abilities to control our population.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: A Shakturi Infiltrator Investigate Unrest Choice Spy Succeeds Defensive Tech Researched 2

GameEvent.Name: A Shakturi Infiltrator Investigate Unrest Choice Spy Succeeds Defensive Tech Researched 2

GameEventAction.Description: The number of Shakturi operatives on our colony suggests that our enemies must have a local base of operation. Our task now is to find it and shut it down.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: A Shakturi Infiltrator Investigate Unrest Choice Spy Succeeds Defensive Tech Researched 3

GameEvent.Name: A Shakturi Infiltrator Investigate Unrest Choice Spy Succeeds Defensive Tech Researched 3

GameEventAction.Description:
Our spy has located the source of Shakturi influence on {0}, a nondescript building on the fringes of the capital city. Our security forces were prepared to enter the facility and noticed an increase in activity. They chose to risk infiltrating early and caught the Shakturi agents planning to destroy the building and themselves. Using our knowledge of Shakturi mind control, we were able to disrupt our enemy's hold on our citizens, thwarting their plans. A study of the materials in the building should greatly enhance our understanding of Shakturi psychic technology.
Across {0}, dozens of citizens found themselves disoriented as they emerged from Shakturi control.
We can find no further evidence of Shakturi activity on {0}, but that doesn't mean they aren't there or that they aren't operating on our other worlds. We will have to operate carefully and cautiously. The Shakturi lurk among us, and they can turn any of our citizens into their pawns. We cannot be safe until this enemy is defeated.

GameEvent.Name: A Shakturi Infiltrator Investigate Unrest Choice Spy Succeeds Defensive Tech Not Researched

GameEventAction.Description:
Something strange is happening on {0}. Individuals our spy has interviewed have gone missing. Others have suddenly collapsed and fallen into comas, later dying.
Several suspects have either eluded capture or escaped from secure facilities, sometimes with the help of prison guards.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: A Shakturi Infiltrator Investigate Unrest Choice Spy Succeeds Defensive Tech Not Researched 2

GameEvent.Name: A Shakturi Infiltrator Investigate Unrest Choice Spy Succeeds Defensive Tech Not Researched 2

GameEventAction.Description:
How is this possible? How do the Shakturi manage to control our citizens so completely? How are their agents able to elude capture, escape, or agree to destroy themselves rather than be captured? What produces this sort of loyalty in their agents.
Our spy believes there must be a leader of the enemy's operation on {0}, and individual or group that manages to recruit new agents. Rather than focusing on individual actors, it may be time to hunt down the source of Shakturi influence on our world.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: A Shakturi Infiltrator Investigate Unrest Choice Spy Succeeds Defensive Tech Not Researched 3

GameEvent.Name: A Shakturi Infiltrator Investigate Unrest Choice Spy Succeeds Defensive Tech Not Researched 3

GameEventAction.Description:
Our spy has located the source of Shakturi influence on {0}, a nondescript building on the fringes of the capital city. Our security forces were prepared to enter the facility when it was destroyed in an explosion. Likely the enemy agents knew they had been discovered and wished to obliterate all evidence of their operation.
Across {0}, dozens of citizens fell dead or collapsed into comas from which they are unlikely ever to emerge. We believe that some sort of alien technology within their headquarters was instrumental in capturing and manipulating our citizens, turning them into Shakturi agents.
We can find no further evidence of Shakturi activity on {0}, but that doesn't mean they aren't there or that they aren't operating on our other worlds. We will have to operate carefully and cautiously. The Shakturi lurk among us, and they can turn any of our citizens into their pawns. We cannot be safe until this enemy is defeated.

GameEvent.Name: A Shakturi Infiltrator Investigate Unrest Choice Spy Fails

GameEventAction.Description: Our spy on {0} has been exposed. Even though we have found no conclusive proof of Shakturi infiltration, we have agitated the public, making them uneasy, many wondering if their family and close associates may be under the control of alien spies. We may only have made the situation worse.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: A Shakturi Infiltrator Investigate Unrest Choice Spy Fails 2

GameEvent.Name: A Shakturi Infiltrator Investigate Unrest Choice Spy Fails 2

GameEventAction.Description: The people of {0} continue to show their discontent. We will have to mollify them as best we can and to prove them wrong by winning this war.

GameEvent.Name: A Shakturi Infiltrator Throw Money at the Problem Choice

GameEventAction.Description:
We have paid certain key figures to stop sowing dissent. We have paid certain media outlets to silence particular voices. We've also invested in a marketing campaign to inform our people that we are working hard to keep them safe and pursuing the war diligently and strategically.
Our efforts seem to have resolved the problem. For now.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: A Shakturi Infiltrator Throw Money at the Problem Choice 2

GameEvent.Name: A Shakturi Infiltrator Throw Money at the Problem Choice 2

GameEventAction.Description:
Our efforts to improve the public's perception of the war on {0} were successful... for a time. Now we are once again seeing unrest and public unhappiness with the war effort.
Spending money to quiet the problem worked for a time, but it may be wise to agitate our public further by investigating the unrest and getting to the root cause. Or we could simply spend more.
GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: A Shakturi Infiltrator Investigate Unrest Choice

GameEventAction.ChoiceButtonText: Throw More Money at the Problem
GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: A Shakturi Infiltrator Throw Money at the Problem Choice 3

GameEvent.Name: A Shakturi Infiltrator Throw Money at the Problem Choice 3

GameEventAction.Description: Once again, money has soothed and silenced the public. We can focus on what matters. For now.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: A Shakturi Infiltrator Throw Money at the Problem Choice 4

GameEvent.Name: A Shakturi Infiltrator Throw Money at the Problem Choice 4

GameEventAction.Description: Using money to pacify our people on {0} seems to be growing less effective. We are seeing new signs of unrest. We may have no choice but to root out the source of the problem, disruptive though that may be.
GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: A Shakturi Infiltrator Investigate Unrest Choice
A Shakturi Infiltrator Investigate Unrest Choice Spy Fails 2

GameEventAction.Description:
We know the Shakturi have powerful psychic abilities. There is every reason to worry they may use these abilities to undermine their enemies and turn them into assets.
It may be wise to use our spies to investigate other empires and search for evidence of Shakturi infiltration. The outcome of the war may be determined not on the battlefield but by the cleverness and resolve of our espionage agents.
Should we send our best spy to investigate matters?

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Foiling Shakturi Spy Success Defensive Tech Researched
Foiling Shakturi Spy Success Defensive Tech Not Researched

GameEvent.Name: Foiling Shakturi Spy Success Defensive Tech Researched

GameEventAction.Description:
Our spy received a tip about irregularities in security procedures among clerical workers at one of {20}'s weapons manufacturing plants. Disguised as a foreign observer, hoping to learn about our allies' procedures, our spy set up an office in the plant and began interviewing employees.
The first interviewed employee attempted to overpower our spy. Fortunately, our spy recognized the signs of Shakturi mind control, and was able to deploy a device developed by our scientists. This freed the Shakturi thrall from their masters' power. At that point, our spy began the work of freeing all of the employees from Shakturi control. The manufacturing plant has been safely returned to our ally's control, and they are grateful to us for our timely intervention.

GameEvent.Name: Foiling Shakturi Spy Success Defensive Tech Not Researched

GameEventAction.Description:
Our spy received a tip about irregularities in security procedures among clerical workers at one of {20}'s weapons manufacturing plants. Disguised as a foreign observer, hoping to learn about our allies' procedures, our spy set up an office in the plant and began interviewing employees. That's where things began to go horribly wrong.
The first interviewed employee attempted to overpower our spy. Though the employee was unsuccessful, the remaining employees all dropped their work and appeared ready to turn violent. Security forces arrived quickly, at which point the agitated employees all fell into comas from which they have not woken.
We must conclude that these workers did not join the Shakturi cause of their own volition. Our enemies have the power to turn ordinary people into dangerous agents who cannot be interrogated or turned back into loyal citizens.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Foiling Shakturi Spy Success Defensive Tech Not Researched 2

GameEvent.Name: Foiling Shakturi Spy Success Defensive Tech Not Researched 2

GameEventAction.Description: That does not mean they cannot be detected, however. Our spy has discovered certain signs that may at least hint at the presence of Shakturi psychic agents. We can use this knowledge to hunt down our enemy's influence more effectively in the future.

We have received more information about our spy. After calling for a meeting with {20}'s security agents, it appears our spy attempted to murder them and was then killed in a fierce battle.
We believe that the Shakturi got to our agent before our agent could get to the Shakturi. This is an important lesson about the power and danger of our enemy.

Our relations with {20} have soured rapidly. They appear openly hostile toward us. There could be any number of reasons why their attitude would shift so suddenly, but we fear this may be the result of Shakturi influence over their culture.
We tire of your meddling in our internal affairs
We are detecting a strange communication emanating from our space, indeed quite near {18}. We cannot pinpoint the exact location of the source of the signal, nor can we understand the communication.

The mysterious signal is a series of magnetic pulses. Our scientists believe it may not represent a language, but possibly a series of complex and interrelated mathematical equations. Many believe these pulses require a response, but we cannot guess what that response might look like.
Several of our researchers stand ready to investigate these pulses in the hopes of solving this mystery.
GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Return of the Ancient Guardians Research Completed

GameEventAction.Description: The mysterious magnetic pulses we’ve detected have increased in strength and frequency. The patterns seem somehow urgent and insistent. Though we’ve been unwilling to invest in researching the phenomenon, some of our scientists are sufficiently intrigued to dedicate their own time to trying to understand these pulses. They believe they are on the cusp of a breakthrough. Moreover, they are now convinced that there is an undeniable intelligence behind the signals, and they hope to be able to communicate with that intelligence very soon.

GameEvent.Name: Return of the Ancient Guardians Research Completed

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Return of the Ancient Guardians Research Completed - Part 2

GameEvent.Name: Return of the Ancient Guardians Research Completed - Part 2

GameEventAction.Description: We have completed our study of the strange magnetic pulses in our home system. We now believe them to be some sort of extremely sophisticated mathematical language. It could be years, perhaps even centuries, before we would be prepared to create any kind of sophisticated message using this language, but we believe we can formulate a simple greeting. We will now proceed.

"Greetings, biological beings! I belong to that race you know as the Ancient Guardians. You have decoded our message and so proved you are sufficiently intelligent to receive our knowledge."
"I am, to my knowledge, the last fully operational individual of my kind. I have hidden myself and avoided contact with the organic creatures of this galaxy, but the realities of the Shakturi invasion require me to be more... sociable than is my nature. You may have already uncovered some of the Vaults of ancient knowledge that we planted throughout the galaxy. There are more than you have likely not uncovered, for they were deliberately hidden lest they be lost before they were needed."
"The hour of their need is here, and yet their recovery is complicated. Many of these Secondary Shakturi-Knowledge Vaults have almost certainly been destroyed. As for the remaining Vaults, their location is unknown even to us. So important was it to preserve them, that we had to compartmentalize the locations, which were unknown even to most of our own kind."
"I have compiled the best available data, and now present the location of the map to the hidden Vaults. Keep in mind, many of the Vaults on the map may no longer exist."
"Also, there is a chance that this transmission will be intercepted by the Shakturi. If so, you can expect a fight when you get to presented coordinates. Good luck to you."
We have discovered the Ancient Guardian map. It reveals multiple locations throughout the galaxy, but we know only some of them will contain intact Vaults. We should begin our search immediately.

Our ship approaching the Shakturi beacon has come under fire by staggeringly destructive weapons. These energy beams are unlike anything in the known galaxy.
The beacons themselves, from what we have been able to determine, are huge and mysterious, covered with incomprehensible alien symbols. Our scientists find that even examining images of these symbols produces headaches, dizziness, and in some cases, hallucinations. We are dealing with an enemy whose writing itself is a kind of weapon.

Near the beacons we've detected violent fissures in which space itself appears to have been brutally ripped open. On the other side of these fissures are lights. Yes, only lights, but to look upon them is to see something unfathomable. Much like the runes on the beacons, these lights produce strange sensations, alien thoughts, and even visions.
Coming into contact with the Shakturi, their technology, or even the effects of their technology, means coming into contact with something far too alien for our minds to comprehend. And something far too dangerous to be tolerated.
When we return, it must be with a powerful fleet prepared to take on this terrible alien power.

That ship! We have never seen anything like it. It is gigantic and terrifying. It's existence appears to defy the laws of engineering. How can a vessel of that size even be constructed?
If we cannot understand how to build such a ship, how can we possibly know how to fight it?

The ship's energy readings are almost beyond our ability to measure. It seems to possess massive weapons systems whose power suggests something beyond battle capability. Those weapons may be designed to destroy stations and do unfathomable destruction to planets. If so, no planet is safe. These ships represent a new and dangerous phase of this war.

Our highest priority must be capturing one of these ships. We have to learn how they are constructed and what weaknesses, if any, they possess. Perhaps once we have one we could learn how to build such ships ourselves.

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: First Shakturi Planet Destroyer Victory Result
First Shakturi Planet Destroyer Victory Result

GameEvent.Name: First Shakturi Planet Destroyer Victory Result

GameEventAction.Description:
It seems that the enemy's massive ships are not invulnerable after all.
Now that we have triumphed over one of these ships, we have the opportunity to study them and unlock their secrets. Creating our own mega-ships could turn the tide of the war and begin a new chapter in our civilization.

Greetings, biological entities! By now you have certainly encountered the beacons the Shakturi have constructed at the galactic rim. These constructs are vital to the Shakturi invasion plan, as the enemy uses them to transport supplies and reinforcements. Neutralizing the beacons will not be easy or without casualties, and yet you must prioritize this task. You cannot hope to defeat the Shakturi without weakening their power.
GameEventAction.ImageFilepath: Environment/Events/Intact Shakturi Psychic Beacon Being Explored

GameEventAction.Description:
We have captured a Shakturi beacon! We have accomplished a task that once seemed impossible, and yet we are no closer to understanding how these constructs work or can be destroyed. Even having captured it does not stop it from transmitting its signal.
We must study the beacon further if we are to learn how to stop its transmissions.

Our scientists studying the Shakturi beacons report experiencing strange dreams and mild hallucinations, almost as though they were present on a Shakturi vessel. They awaken disoriented certain they now understand significant aspects of Shakturi technology... only to have this knowledge fade within seconds.
Many of our researchers cannot tolerate this proximity to the beacon, and the turnover rate is high. We have to hope our efforts prove worth the effort.

We have completed our initial research into the workings of the Shakturi beacon. There is still much we don't understand, but we know enough that we can prevent the beacon from transmitting.
As long as the beacon exists, it remains a threat. Our scientists are convinced that if they can spend more time studying the beacon, they will learn how to destroy it. We also stand to learn much about Shakturi technology in the process. Yet we also have to consider the effect this research is having on our scientists. Even after they leave the project, they remain troubled and distracted. There is much to consider.

GameEvent.Name: Study Destroy Shakturi Beacon Research Completed

GameEventAction.Description: We have completed our research on the Shakturi beacon and discovered the means to destroy it. Initiating destruct sequence now!

GameEventAction.GeneratedItemName: Study Destroy Shakturi Beacon Research Completed 2

GameEvent.Name: Study Destroy Shakturi Beacon Research Completed 2

GameEventAction.Description:
The beacon has been destroyed. The reverberations were felt across multiple systems. There have been reports of nightmares, strange visions, dizziness, and confusion. All very unpleasant, but surely a small price to pay.
In the wreckage we have discovered some sort of Shakturi device, perhaps something like a computer. We believe it powered many of the beacon's operations, but it also seems to have run many of the beacon's automated systems. It is the inherent psychic energy in this device, which we call the Beacon Core, that we suspect caused the nightmares and disorientation experienced by our scientists.
We believe that this device can be used to enhance our defenses against psychic attack. It also contains properties that can be weaponized against our enemies. Our spies can use this device when carrying out missions in which they seek to foment rebellion. The Beacon core should significantly increase their chances of success.

This war is unlike anything we have experienced since we returned to the stars. Our ancestors fought the Shakturi, and though they survived, that war sent the galaxy into a thousand years of darkness. We cannot allow history to repeat itself. Indeed, if we lose this war, the results could be far worse even than the horrors suffered by our forebears.
It is time for a meeting with our top generals, admirals, scientists, spies. Representatives of other empires at war with the Shakturi have joined us. We must establish our grand strategy not merely for survival, but for victory.

Our meeting has proved most productive. Based on everything we have learned, we now believe we must achieve the following goals if we are to defeat the Shakturi.
1. We must [B]destroy their beacons[/B] in order to inhibit their ability to receive supplies and reinforcements from their home galaxy.
2. We must [B]learn to defeat their Planet Destroyer ships[/B], and build our own ships of similar size.
3. We must [B]stop their ability to spread psychic plague[/B] and, perhaps use their technology against them and create plagues of our own.
4. We must learn how to [B]eliminate the threat of the Rift Striders[/B] and Shakturi genetic engineering in general, which poses the threat of turning other space creatures against us.
If we can achieve these four goals, then victory becomes possible, though never certain. Yet such goals are easier imagined than achieved. Our work lies ahead of us, and the fate of the galaxy depends upon our efforts.

GameEventAction.MessageTitle: Our Troops Have Defected During Battle!
GameEventAction.Description:
One of our troop units has rebelled during the battle at {0}! They have switched sides to the dreaded Shakturi!
It seems that the Shakturi were somehow able to use their psychic influence to persuade the troops to join them.
How can we counter this frightening new ability?
Our scientists recommend that we immediately begin research in [RESEARCH]Psychic Defense Fields[/RESEARCH] and any follow-on projects.

We are hearing reports of a massive fleet appearing at one of the Shakturi beacon locations.
The fleet has one especially enormous ship of a type that we have not seen before. This colossal warship appears to be built around a single huge weapon.
What could be the purpose of a weapon this large?
It feels as though something fundamental has changed in the galaxy. A deep sense of foreboding washes over all sentient life...

GeneratedItemEventNames.string: Investigate Vault of the Shakturi Mind

GameEventAction.Description:
"Greetings, biological entities. We withheld the location of this final Vault from you because the information it contains is exceedingly dangerous. Nevertheless, the danger posed by the Shakturi and their destructive Planet Destroyer ships is such that we have no choice. I can only hope you have the wisdom to use responsibly the information I now reveal to you."
"Good luck to you. The fate of the galaxy is in your hands."

The time has come again for the Shakturi to dominate all in this galaxy!
You may have been able to stop us once before in the distant past, but our time trapped in the void of gravitic space has taught us much.
And now we have emerged and relit the beacons of old. We have called upon massive reinforcements from our home galaxy.
Our mighty Shaktur Axis now declares WAR against your pitiful Freedom Alliance! We will purge you from the galaxy.
Your feeble Freedom Alliance cannot stop us from taking what is ours - our victory is unavoidable and inevitable!
Your pitiful friends will flee in terror once they witness the devastation we are about to unleash...
Your end has arrived.

The time has come again for the Shakturi to dominate all in this galaxy!
You may have been able to stop us once before in the distant past, but our time trapped in the void of gravitic space has taught us much.
And now we have emerged and relit the beacons of old. We have called upon massive reinforcements from our home galaxy.
Your feeble Freedom Alliance cannot stop us from taking what is ours - our victory is unavoidable and inevitable!
Your pitiful friends will flee in terror once they witness the devastation we are about to unleash...
Your end has arrived.
